intro: Tylophora barbata, commonly known as the hairy tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often found in moist, tropical forests. Tylophora barbata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
